Condition_summary_1: The Proponent must implement offsetting measures including marsh habitat creation, tributary restoration, riparian buffer planting, and storm water management pond expansion to mitigate habitat impacts. Contingency measures are required if these measures fail to meet criteria.
Condition_summary_2: Monitoring and reporting are mandatory, including post-construction assessments, fish sampling, and vegetation survival checks. Reports must be submitted by June 14, 2022.
Condition_summary_3: No deleterious substances may be deposited in water frequented by fish. Work must comply with Fisheries Act and other regulations.
Condition_summary_4: The Proponent is responsible for all design and safety aspects. Authorization cannot be transferred without prior DFO notification.
Habitat_Type: marsh habitat, unnamed tributary restoration, riparian buffer, storm water management pond
Fish_species: None explicitly listed in section 4; general references to fish utilization in offsetting measures
Offset_footprint_size: marsh habitat (expanded sections), Hooper Drain channel (realigned), Lavallee Creek tributary (restored), riparian buffer (80% coverage required), SWM pond (average depth 0.9m)
Vegetation_Cover: 80% survival for aquatic vegetation and riparian plantings
Woody_coverage: Habitat enhancement features (e.g., woody debris) must show no destabilization
Instream_structures: Habitat enhancement features in channels must remain stable
